review_blob: On tap @ Parkway on 16Feb, then again at Red Hot on 19Feb.  Seemed slightly thinner, crisper the second time around.  Awesome from start to finish. Medium body, lively, astringent, amber, clear, white foam, very reminiscent of Pliny, especially the aroma.  Interesting that the older ratings here are just mediocre but all recent are very good - has Boneyard mixed it up a bit?  Whatever, its great now!
Definitely grapefruit and one of the most bitter back of tongue IPAs Ive ever had.  But is that cloves I taste? Interesting, unique, but not my style.

For my preferences, this is a nearly perfect beer, with Pliny the Elder being the standard-bearer.  As such this reminds me greatly of the Elder, though with a slight advantage of tasting less alcohol.  At Parkway Taverns IPA Fest, 28Sep2010.
